description: CRITICAL: Domain models must represent code as closely as possible. Code should represent domain concepts. If code doesn't match domain concepts, refactor the code rather than creating abstract domain models.

do.description: Domain models should represent code closely
content: Domain models should match actual code implementation
If code doesn't match domain, refactor the code

dont.description: Don't create abstract domain models that don't match code
content: Don't create abstract domain models with no code basis
Don't separate domain models from code implementation
- Domain concepts that don't exist in code
- Collaborators that are abstract concepts without code representation
- Domain models that describe ideal state rather than actual code
